website_summaries.verdict: The type of engine starter fluid to choose when you want the best results in a short amount of time.
pros: Can be applied to a number of different types of engines, including ones found on smaller appliances like lawnmowers
Fast-acting to quickly get the engine up and running
Great for starting engines coming out of long periods of storage
cons: Can run a little thin when first using it

customer_reviews.title: My 4-month old (4-month old!!!!! ...
customer_reviews.text: My 4-month old (4-month old!!!!!) Husqvarna leaf blower was struggling to start, and finally refused completely (PS ... they seem to be known for this). I brought it to an authorized service center who said the carburetor (in fact, all the parts that can possibly break) was not covered (I think they cover the strap unraveling and that's it.) It would cost me between $75 and $125 to clean and diagnose the problem (not necessarily fix it.) Half a container of this stuff ... and it started on the first try!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard C

customer_reviews.title: I’ll keep a can in my shop from now on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fix some non running and poorly running small engines I have. First try was an old old Homelite chainsaw I couldn’t get to start even after fresh 2 stroke pre-mix gas. After a quick shot of this, it was running after 2 pulls! I’m sold on this product so far! I can’t wait to try it in some other small engines I have.
customer_reviews.author: sm1999

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is AMAZING!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is AMAZING!!! I moved and wasn’t able to get to my bike for a few years, it was seriously neglected. It wouldn’t start, and when it finally did, it was awful. My friend recommended this and it has saved me HUNDREDS of dollars on a carb clean. It took a full tank a gas and several runs to get there but my bike is finally running like it should again. I would HIGHLY recommend this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rollins96

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works!
customer_reviews.text: Had a snowblower that we left the gas in from the year before. Wouldn't start. Added the whole can (2 oz) to the gas tank with new gas (on top of the old!), primed it 10x, waited 5-10 minutes, started immediately! Will remember to use throughout the season next time and will also run the blower out of gas at the end of the season and start with FRESH gas next year. Learned that gas breaks down quickly now and I don't start the blower very often. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: starma58

customer_reviews.title: Wanted it to work. Small can.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this worked for others. I tried a full can over the course of about an hour in the gas tank (with and without new gas), in the choke opening, in the spark plug hole, without success. I'm trying to get a Echo PB2520 blower to start. The blower is less than a year old, but I haven't used it in about two months. Maybe something else is wrong with it that this product can't fix. BTW, this is a very small can -- 2 oz. vs. what you might be used to in a starting fluid 11 or 12 oz can. Hope it works for you.
customer_reviews.author: okwoodworker

customer_reviews.title: Got my snowblower running again
customer_reviews.text: I had a snowblower with a tank full of gas and stabilizer over the summer. When I tried starting it this winter, it did start twice, but the third time, no such luck. I went to several area auto parts stores but all everyone had was a spray for the carburator, which requires taking a few pieces off which I did not want to do. So I tried some alternatives that you pour into the gas tank, but they did nothing. So I ordered this product and my snowblower is running again. In fact, I'm letting it run until all the old gas is used up. But this product really did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: daniell

customer_reviews.title: Problematic lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Craftsman lawn mower up at a mountain cabin that sits for periods of time and is very stubborn to start, Even cleaning the carburetor did not really help. I was going to trash it and buy a new one so I thought I'd try this stuff. BOOM!!! The mower started on the 2nd pull of the cord and ran like a champ. VERY happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Works. Just buy.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works. I tried everything. I put new fuel in my snowblower and she would not start. I cleaned out the carburetor and the snowblower still wouldn’t start. I then sprayed a little bit of this into the carbeurator and she started first pull. I also got it to start a non-running lawnmower. The stuff works. No more to be said.
customer_reviews.author: Derrin000

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: used on my Snow Blower, lawn mower and emergency generator. looks it does work as the snow blower was acting up and running rough on idle because I left it for some time with old gas, it it is sounding like new. I didn't try it on extreme case when the machine wouldn't even start
customer_reviews.author: M. A.

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This really works!!! Saved us money and from having to call someone to help fix the snowblower! I read a kind women's review on here and how much she believed in this product, so I figured it was worth a try. It worked!!!
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: Still on the workbench in my garage
customer_reviews.text: Decided not to use this product after Amazon's 30 day return rules. One star because I never used it, therefore couldn't rate it. I was advised against using this product and just dump, replace the old gasoline (14 month old ethanol free gasoline from two motorcycles).
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sewell

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works.
customer_reviews.text: I had an edger that is seldom used and it would only run if I pored the gas into the carb. I tried this and it worked. I put this in the tank with some fresh gas and primed the carb with some gas and it started up and keep on running. I used it to edge my lawn I have been starting it up every week and it starts every time.
customer_reviews.author: DKT

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This definitely works. I have a lawn mower that will not start. I bought a new filter and spark plug which didn't help. I was ready to get a new lawn mower but decided to try this first. I am glad that I waited since this did the job! I only need to add a little bit when I put gas in, and it starts right away!
customer_reviews.author: MKB

customer_reviews.title: expensive, but cheaper than a new chipper
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical when I saw this product in the store, but I checked it out on Amazon and it looked legit. I had worked on my mower for about 45 mins, looked at the spark plug, replaced the gas, added more oil and it still was not working after dozens of pulls. Then, I added about 1/4-1/3 bottle of this stuff and within 3 pulls there was a cough and 2 secs of darker colored smoke and the after that the engine works fine. Ran it for a little while and stopped it and restarted it a couple minutes later. This stuff ain't cheap but neither is a service call.
customer_reviews.author: Chunkychen

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical of product at first
customer_reviews.text: but it worked great in starting my old Craftsman mower which had set in the shed for close to three years. I did nothing but spray the formula into the tank, prime the engine, and after only a few pulls it cranked right up. The engine ran strong, no sputtering, and I could use the mower immediately. It's a miracle in a spray can!
customer_reviews.author: Beat the Virus

customer_reviews.title: Started an engine that had been sitting for 10 years
customer_reviews.text: Had an old trimmer that was stored in the shed for 10 years with fuel mix in it. Of course it wouldn't start. It was supposed to be stored empty of fuel. Duh. So I purchased this, poured the right amount in the fuel tank, cranked it a couple times and let it sit for about a week before trying again. Frankly, I didn't figure ANYTHING was likely to get the thing running again. It took a few pulls, but the thing started and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Woodburner

customer_reviews.title: Restarted My 2 Stroke Chainsaw !
customer_reviews.text: Had a fairly new chainsaw 2 stroke that was only used a few times. Kept stalling and acted like needed more choke. Added gas with “Start Your Engine” and within 10 min was running great! Ran so well it would sit and idle on the ground with no misfires.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Smith

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, must have !
customer_reviews.text: Wow I just purchased this product and used it on a mower that has been intorage for 6 years. Sprayed it into the fuel tank and topped off with fresh fuel...let sit for an hour and sprayed into the carb. After about 3 tries it fired right up and ran like brand new again ! This is one product that stands by what it says ! A must have !
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J

customer_reviews.title: Did not work on my Toro snowbloer
customer_reviews.text: Product didn’t work for me. My Toro snowblower would not start so I took apart my carb and sprayed it with this product. I could only get the snowblower to start for a couple of seconds before it would shut back down. Did this 3 times and then gave up.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works great
customer_reviews.text: In the spring when it's time to start up the lawn mower Start Your Engines Starter Fluid really helps get my older mower going.
customer_reviews.author: markw.c

customer_reviews.title: Amazing - lifesaver.
customer_reviews.text: My snow blower would not start and I had already filled the tank with gasoline. I bought this stuff and sprayed some into the gas tank per the instructions. I waited a few minutes and then the snow blower started right up. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: NewEnglander

customer_reviews.title: Great to use to start a lawn mower.
customer_reviews.text: I’m am eighty and this makes starting my lawn mower so easy. The mower usually starts on the second pull. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Isbell

customer_reviews.title: Works!!
customer_reviews.text: Works every time for my tools. Wood splitter was in storage for a year...started after two pulls. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Pozzi

customer_reviews.title: When everything else failed "This Will amaze you.
customer_reviews.text: My mower sat for a year.It would not start.Installed new plug/filter ."""STOP" Right there I purchased this and the mower runs beautiful."Your "BEST INVESTMENT" ever
customer_reviews.author: Maura O.

customer_reviews.title: A friend recommended this stuff after my pressure washer didnt start
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this stuff after my pressure washer didnt start. I had left gas in it which i was told not to do. I put half in and it didnt start so I put the rest in and it started. So excited! I didnt have to have someone come get it started for me. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Locket86

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works like a dream!! Use as directed or just do like I did and just spray a ton of this down in the carb, wait a few minutes, then crank away!
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Trombone

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: got my old tiller started after a 2 year storage.
customer_reviews.author: uncle mike

customer_reviews.title: Used the whole can, but it worked
customer_reviews.text: I used it to start my snowblower that was sitting for 3 years. Gas was bad but I used half of the can first and it didn't start so I added the rest and let it sit for 10 minuets then it started. I had to finish the bad gas by letting it run till it died.
customer_reviews.author: A.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Used a regular starting fluid on my mower but had to reapply the next week. Used this stuff one time and haven't had to reapply to get it started. Also used it on a trimmer that normally gives me a hard time starting up. Hadn't started it sinc last season. Applied this stuff. Let sit for 5 minutes and started up like it was new. Just purchased another bottle for a pressure washer that I'll treat too.
customer_reviews.author: B. Nieves

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great! I had a sears push mower that was acting up uneven idle wanted to stall out put this in gas tank all the problems went away on the next time I used it saved a 100 dollar repair I recammend it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Feraco

customer_reviews.title: What a waste!
customer_reviews.text: This product used to be a liquid that was added to the gas tank to help start your engine, especially when starting it up the first time of the season. Now, it's and aerosol where most of it escapes out the tank opening instead of getting into the fuel and the engine where it needs to be. What a waste!
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Unsurpassed success
customer_reviews.text: Best product for small engine fuel additive, prior use confirms quality, and successful starting
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Duva-Ganino

customer_reviews.title: This thing worked
customer_reviews.text: We had some trouble starting our lawn mower after winter for the first time. We used this and it helped! Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lifestyle by design

customer_reviews.title: Saved me $100, worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Used the product to start a snowblower that had stale gas over 18 months. Drained the gas tank, poured in a pint of new fuel, added the Start your engine, waited 20 minutes and blower started on 2nd pull. Did the trick
customer_reviews.author: Richardlandis

customer_reviews.title: Used in my generator that would not start. While ...
customer_reviews.text: Used in my generator that would not start. While it will not stay started at this point I believe this product helped clean out the fuel lines. The generator now starts but only runs for about a minute. Need to look at motor further but this product definitely helped
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Saved my bacon!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been pleasantly surprised with this product - I was having a very difficult time starting my mower this spring but this product saved me. One application to the gas tank and it started with one pull. I have been adding It to my 2 gallon storage tank and it has worked all summer.

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked just as advertised. Started my lawnmower that had sat all winter on first try.

customer_reviews.text: It may help some, not sure it’s worth then money

customer_reviews.text: Tried to start 3 different Stihl trimmers and 2 chainsaws. Bought 6 cans. Couldn't get any of the machines to start. Waste of money.

customer_reviews.title: I've been using this as part of my routine maintenance ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this as part of my routine maintenance and on the occasional engine with forgotten about fuel. Seems to help, doesn't hurt anything.

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Start is like a fire extinguisher. You hope you don't need it but it is great to have on hand when you need to use seasonal equipment that has been used for months. Especially good for generators.

customer_reviews.text: I hadn't started my motorcycle in more than a year. I popped this into the gas tank, and it cranked with no problems.

customer_reviews.text: Too many things on the farm you think you're going to use again so you don't drain the gas and then life happens and now it full of bad gas. You can dump it and pour a little in the tank with fresh gas and the motor starts right up.

I have a string trimmer that I had not been able to start for weeks. I followed the instructions and it started on the second pull and has started every time since then.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old snow blower (Ariens 620) just started on the first pull after sitting idle for 10 months. Amazing.

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: After changing spark plug and air filter my lawn equipment still would not start. Poured in half a bottle of this and a few more cranks. Bam it works.

customer_reviews.title: This stuff really works!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has helped me out at least three different times. My tiller and my pressure washer thank you! Just put it in the gas and they start! I find it very useful!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Ritter

customer_reviews.title: Used it in a power washer that was not started ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it in a power washer that was not started in over a year and was having trouble turning over. Ended up using full container in 2 doses and it did start up, saved a trip to repair shop.
customer_reviews.author: PandBH

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works. Let's face it, I'm not mechanically inclined. I got a new "spill proof" gas can, and couldn't figure out how to use it, and somehow spilled gas all over my mower with my "spill proof" can. It got in places gas shouldn't go, and the mower I had just had serviced wouldn't start. Enter Start Your Engines. I poured half the bottle in the gas tank, waited a few minutes, and voila the mower started. This stuff works for me every time. It's helped me out of enough jams that I keep a bottle on hand at all times.
customer_reviews.author: onlineshopper

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Use this stuff and your mower will start up every time.

customer_reviews.text: Had a carburater problem with my lawnmower. It's running great now!

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I was about to give up on my generator. It is so hard to start. I tried and tried. So, I purchased this as a last resort and it started right up.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really does the trick helping hard to start snowblowers and lawnmowerd.

customer_reviews.title: as promised
customer_reviews.text: No surprises here, everything on time as promised. Quality is excellent and product is correct. I would expect nothing less when buying through Amazon.

customer_reviews.title: It'll make you smile and pat your wallett....
customer_reviews.text: No matter how old or worn your small engine tool is; you should give this product a shot before throwing up your hands and buying a new one....I'm a true believer that there is "no such thing as a repair in a bottle"...Well, Start your engines could prove to be the best $9 you spend this year.
customer_reviews.author: FALAR15

customer_reviews.title: Excellent results. Used at start of season in lawn ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent results. Used at start of season in lawn mower after changing spark plug, it started in two pulls and ran great. Also used in Stihl backpack blower that is 5 yrs old. Again, changed the spark plug and added Start Your Engines! Stihl products usually start well but mine had become a little slower in starting over time. Not it starts in 1-2 pulls. I had previously noted that the primer bulb was slow to fill and return to expanded position. To my surprise the bulb now pushes in easily and pops right back out. Suspect jets/fill lines have been cleaned with Start Your Engines. Will definitely keep this on hand for all of my power tools.
customer_reviews.author: Brewster

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a portable generator in the winter
customer_reviews.text: I did not think this would wrork but IT DID-all I did is add it to the tank and wala-worked on first pull. This is a great product-highly recommended.if you have a portable generator-you will need it in the winter especially when it gets really cold.,
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Gorman Sr.

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works! Made starting weed eater and blower that had not been running in over a year a breeze.

customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for stubborn little 2-stroke engines.

customer_reviews.title: I put this in and bam it purred like a kitten
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works miracles. If you don't use a fuel stabilizer this is a must. Try this before messing around with the carburetor. This worked for me. I left the gas in my brand new snowblower last year and the first heavy snowstorm it would t start. I put this in and bam it purred like a kitten. Good stuff to keep on hand.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fixed the rough idle on my mower after one tankful of gas and start your engines
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One shot
customer_reviews.text: The ingredients of this product will quickly evaporate, meaning they can only be used to revitalize stale fuel you intend to use up. If you have a full tank of gas that has gone stale that you only plan to use half of the tank that day, you'll need to add more of this to the tank next time you plan to use the engine. Think of this as starting fluid in a can. It doesn't go that far, especially if you have a large gas tank on a generator for example.
customer_reviews.author: Abi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worded on old string trinner, with old has in it!

customer_reviews.title: Saved us from buying a new weed eater!
customer_reviews.text: We hadn't used our weed eater in about a year. The weed eater wouldn't start and we tried draining the fuel and putting in new and replacing spark plugs. None of this worked. Start your Engines worked great though and saved us from buying a new weed eater. We've used the weed eater several times now and it's still going strong.

customer_reviews.title: It starts!
customer_reviews.text: Pour it in. Let it sit a bit...start 'er up!!

customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing! I have tried it in several engines both 2 cycle and 4cycle that were hard to start or ran poorly. I think I saved a large rebuild bill on the carburetor by trying "Start Your Engines" first. The tool runs great and starts on the first pull. Half in the tank and half in the gas can as per instructions did the trick.

customer_reviews.text: Pour it in and fire it up! Stuff works great!

customer_reviews.title: the 4 wheeler start up after a little coaching and runs fine. It had been stored for a year with ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked as advertised , the 4 wheeler start up after a little coaching and runs fine. It had been stored for a year with fuel in it. We put in new fuel with the start added nothing more.
customer_reviews.author: James Richartz

customer_reviews.title: A Small Caution
customer_reviews.text: Product worked well, got a wood chipper that has not started without starting fluid for 3 years to start on the first pull, something it newer did since I've owned it. Also a weed wacker that had been in storage for 2 years. However on a snow blower that was in storage for 10 years, it worked too good. Something that was likely held together by gunk, began to leak. So for something that's been in storage for a real long time. Check first for hoses etc. that have physically deteriorated before using.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this stuff works!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a gas weed whacker start up after sitting idle for two years. I have used on my snow blower after it was put away for the season with no stabilizer in the gas. You need to add it and try to start the item you have added it to. If it doesn't start right up give it time to sit and it will start within a day. I keep on hand for use as needed.
customer_reviews.author: marjala

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I was not sure if this would work in my motorcycles but, I am glad to say I was wrong. It worked so well I will put it in the tanks along with a fuel stabilizer to make sure next year I don't have any issues. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Completely gelled up in my carburetor.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product! I used this in my Honda lawn mower and had to take the carb apart to clean out all of the gunk this left behind...on 3 back to back occasions! Once I dumped this junk out and got fresh fuel the mower ran like new again, after yet another carb cleaning. One of the worst products I've ever bought and a ripoff too. I would definitely recommend Sta-Bil instead for fuel stabilizing needs.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Wow, I'm a believer. I used this to ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I'm a believer. I used this to help start my Gravely lawnmower after a long winter. The year before I emptied the gas tank and ran the engine dry, but I forgot to do that this year. I had 8 month old gas in the tank and the engine would not start. Put fresh gas in to no avail. I had to charge the battery twice. I decided to try this stuff out. Just pour it in the tank and add some fresh gas. It started on the first shot. 5/5 from me!
customer_reviews.author: krisr2005

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Fixed one item, but not another. Worth a shot though.
customer_reviews.author: B. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: It started my engine
customer_reviews.text: Had a push mower that sat for two years. Couldn't get it to start. Cleaned the spark plug, cleaned the air filter, fiddled with the pump and choke. I wore my arm out trying to yank the cord a hundred times. I put this into the tank, pumped the primer three times and it started on the first pull of the cord. If you're unaware of a mechanical issue it's definitely worth trying this before you take it to a shop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: After being in storage for several months, my power washer would not start. I then checked to make sure that fuel was reaching the carburator and that the spark plug was working. I tried to start it several more times. No luck. After pouring Start Your Engines into the tank, I pulled the starter four more times and it started, ran a little rough for a while but then smoothed out and ran perfectly. This is a great product that does exactly what it is advertised to do.
customer_reviews.author: William Jackson

customer_reviews.title: The product works great and does as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in all my outdoor power equipment ranging from lawnmowers to generators to tillers and pressure washers. The product works great and does as advertised. Doing some research on the internet, the way this product works is that it adds back lighter components of gasoline that evaporate and lowers the flash point of the gasoline by 20-30 degrees so that it makes the gasoline extremely combustible.
customer_reviews.author: Karl C

customer_reviews.title: It works to a degree
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked when it actually worked and miraculously started my old lawnmower. However, a few days later it wouldn't start anymore. Do I have to buy a new bottle each time?
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Francis

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: My MTD snow blower has always been very difficult to start, and requires constant adjustment to the choke to keep it running. As it got older, it just didn’t start or run. THIS seriously fixed it! Not only does it start and run no problem, but it continually worked all season. This year I added a bit more to the fuel and again no problems! It seriously runs better than new!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: Certainly after also cleaning the carb on a problematic snow blower each season to start, this product got it started immediately! I can't say the same for the mower, though it has sat for years without use and likely I need clean that carb out too. Gas will gel up like oil over time, so don't expect miracles, else ensure one runs any machine dry at the end of each season!
customer_reviews.author: Gidagorfen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: helped out on the inital start up have no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Henry Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for the small amouny of gas its good for
customer_reviews.text: The price of this isn't justified for thew small amount of gas it treats. I thought for the price it would treat a few small engines I have, it was enough for maybe two of them, and I didn't notice any difference in how they ran at all, in fact one ran worse. I wouldn't waste my money on it again
customer_reviews.author: kwb75

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to winterize my lawnmower and 2 outboard boat motors last fall. I followed the directions on the bottle of Start Your Engines! and all 3 motors started right up, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Bartlett

product_meta.title: Start Your Engines! Fuel System Revitalizer and Starter Fluid for 2 and 4 Cycle Small Engines, 2 Fl. oz.
product_meta.description: Size:2 fl oz.STA-BIL Start Your Engine! Fuel System Revitalizer is designed to ensure easy starting of outdoor power equipment, smooth rough idling and stalling, and helps remove gum and varnish from throttle plate and carburetor. One 2 ounce container will treat up to 1 gallon of fuel and will revitalize old fuel.
feature_bullets: Additive ensures quick easy starts after extended storage, and ensures smooth idling and performance in season
Revitalizes fuel and the entire fuel system
